result.execSummary:
The defendant CHRISTOPHER D. WRIGHT was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Court calls case and appearances. State offers plea agreement on the record. Atty Erdman agrees. Court questions the defendant re: his plea questionnaire and waiver of rights form. Court finds the defendant freely and knowingly waives his rights. Court finds there is a factual basis. 


Count 1-DRI

Count 2-DRI

Count 3-Defendant pleas guilty. Court accepts plea and finds the def. guilty. 


State speaks re: sentencing. Atty Erdman makes statement. Defendant makes statement. Court sentences the defendant.

2 years probation + costs
